noun.description: In South India: the holder of a pollam or estate; a subordinate chief.
A member of a class of marauding outlaws; (hence) a member of a people regarded as having descended from these outlaws.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in English Factories in India. From Marathi pāḷegār marauding outlaw, poligar from Marathi pāḷẽ confined valley + Persian -gār agent suffix (goes to Kannada pāḷegāra, pāḷeyagāra, Telugu pāḷegāḍu).
